title: 108_hr5182
content: The "Homeland Security Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2004" ensures that civil rights and liberties are not compromised in homeland security efforts. It also establishes an Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties within the Department of Homeland Security. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure civil rights and liberties are protected in Department programs. The Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties will report directly to the Secretary and oversee compliance with constitutional and statutory requirements. The Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties will ensure the protection of civil rights and liberties in Department programs. They will oversee compliance with legal requirements, coordinate with other officials, and investigate complaints of possible abuses. SEC. 4. PROTECTION OF CIVIL RIGHTS AND CIVIL LIBERTIES BY OFFICE OF INSPECTOR GENERAL. Designation and Functions of Senior Official to oversee compliance with legal requirements and investigate complaints of possible abuses. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of abuses of civil rights and liberties, receive complaints, and initiate investigations within the department and its contractors or grantees. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of alleged abuses of civil rights and civil liberties by department employees, contractors, or grantees. This official ensures personnel receive proper training, consults with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, provides investigation outcomes, and refers relevant matters. The Inspector General designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of civil rights and liberties abuses, provide outcomes to the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, refer relevant matters, publicize complaint procedures, and report weaknesses within the Department. The Privacy Officer under Section 222 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to report directly to the Secretary and coordinate with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties to ensure integrated handling of programs involving civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy considerations.
